definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

sentences.english: Confucius thought it is stupid and hollow saying.
sentences.chinese: 孔老夫子认为这些都是痴人说梦的空话。

sentences.english: "Oh you naughty Whisker, " said the old lady.
sentences.chinese: “唔，你这个调皮的威斯克呀，”老夫人说道。

sentences.english: Do not think that old couple, do not sweet talk and the romantic.
sentences.chinese: 不要以为老夫老妻，就不要甜言蜜语和浪漫了。

sentences.english: Only the old lady Kung escaped.
She hurried home and turned everything topsy-turvy to find the lives to save.
sentences.chinese: 余老夫人急忙赶回家，翻箱倒柜地找待救之物。

sentences.english: Later, the old couple began to feel sorry for her and brought her out a small stool.
sentences.chinese: 后来，老夫妻竟有些过意不去，给她拿出一只小板凳。

sentences.english: Old Mrs. Yu woke up. She was confused by this weird dream.
sentences.chinese: 余老夫人醒过来，难解这个希罕的梦。
我只知道，老夫今年七十三了。

sentences.english: No one knew that we were an "old" married couple.
sentences.chinese: 没有人知道我们是一对“老夫老妻”。

sentences.english: Sigh, First I will get the Professor back then talk about it.
sentences.chinese: 唉等我先把老夫子取出来再说罢。
老夫人读着读着，泪水如小河流水般奔涌而出。

sentences.english: The couple is reluctant to have this conversation.
sentences.chinese: 这对老夫妻不愿意进行这次谈话。

sentences.english: Blessed with five lovely grandchildren, the old couple feel content.
sentences.chinese: 有五个可爱的孙子孙女，这对老夫妻感到很满足。

sentences.english: He has been reading books all his life, and has become a pedant.
sentences.chinese: 他读了一辈子的书，到头来不过是一个彻底的老夫子。

sentences.english: The old parents did not know what to say.
sentences.chinese: 这对老夫妻真不知道说些什么。

definition: lit. your honored carriage/your highness/honored Sir (also sarcastic)/you
the younger generation/those who come after
(affectionate form of address for a male who is not very much younger than oneself) my boy/old pal
I (first person pronoun used by royalty or nobility)
(coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
head of a clan/natural leader/person of prestige and authority in a domain/suzerain
